 Bible prophecy ALONE PROVES that the Bible is God's revelation to man. It is not possible for finite man to fortell future events with absolute accuracy as God does in the Scriptures.

 
 Strictly speaking, even if the bible did contain genuine prophecies, it would not prevent the rest of it from being the work of man's own hand. 
 
 Also, here's a quick list of 204 prophecies that either never came (and now never can come) to pass, or which the bible itself contradicts.
 
 Of those prophecies which are usually held up as having been fulfilled, none survive critical review. Take the foundation of Israel, for example: Jews have been actively trying to regain their ancestral lands precisely because of what they perceive as a prophecy saying it will happen. A prophecy which someone deliberately and with prior knowledge causes to be fulfilled at some random point in the future is not a genuine prophecy. I could predict with 100% accuracy what I'm going to eat for breakfast every day for the rest of my life - that wouldn't make it a prophecy.

Here's an actual 'prophecy' by a local WofF pastor I obtained a few years ago. Was to be used as evidence in a court case...
 
 Here it is presented Verbatum.
 
 
Prophecy, Monday June 20, 2005
 Pastor M*** J***
 
 Time indeed for my plan to come forth in your life. Miss not my plan, for my plan is critical, my plan Is essential. My plan is critical for your life so pray and seek me and let it be known that the plan of God is being revealed and the will of God is being made known. No, I am not keeping you in secret from anything that I need to tell you, but many are on the perimeter of my plan and not in the center so be sure you make the corrections and be sure you commit to get in the center of my will. For this is the time to be in my life saith the Lord. 

 
 And no, unfortunatly M*J* isn't Mojo Jojo from the Powerpuff Girls...but it could stand for Mary Jane, which is what it appears some Prophets of God seem to be on when they utter such cultic nonsense.
